Kemnaker Tunggu Laporan Semua Provinsi Terkait Penetapan Upah Minimum
03 Nov 2019, 14:17 by Satrio Widianto
JAKARTA, (PR).- Dirjen Pembinaan Hubungan Industrial dan Jaminan Sosial Tenaga Kerja (PHI dan Jamsos) Kementerian Ketenagakerjaan, Haiyani Rumondang mengatakan, sampai saat ini pihak Kemnaker masih melakukan pemantauan penetapan Upah Minimum Provinsi (UMP) oleh para gubernur.
"Hari ini kami terus melakukan pemantauan dan pengumpulan laporan penetapan UMP dari daerah-daerah dari seluruh Indonesia," kata Haiyani dalam keterangan pers Biro Humas Kemnaker, di Jakarta, Jumat 3 November 2019.
Menurut Haiyani, kenaikan UMP 2020 dihitung berdasarkan formula yang sesuai dengan Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) Nomor 78 Tahun 2015 tentang pengupahan. Penetapan UMP 2020 berdasarkan Pasal 9 Peraturan Menteri Ketenagakerjaan Nomor 15 Tahun 2018 tentang Upah Minimum ditetapkan dan diumumkan secara serentak oleh Gubernur setiap daerah pada tanggal 1 November 2019 dengan keputusan gubernur.
"Jadi intinya untuk menetapkan UMP tahun 2020 merupakan kewenangan Gubernur. Berdasarkan data Inflasi dan Pertumbuhan Ekonomi Nasional dari BPS kenaikan Upah Minimum Provinsi (UMP) 2020 sebesar 8,51%," kata Haiyani.
Direktur Pengupahan Kemnaker, Dinar Titus Jogaswitani menambahkan hingga Jumat, 1 November 2019, sudah 20 provinsi yang mengumumkan penetapan dan menyampaikan laporan tentang penetapan upah minimum provinsi (UMP) 2020 kepada Kemnaker. 
Dari 20 provinsi yang telah menyampaikan laporan tentang besaran UMP tersebut, sebanyak 19 sudah sesuai dengan Peraturan Pemerintah Nomor 78 Tahun 2015 tentang Pengupahan. "Namun 1 provinsi diantaranya masih tidak sesuai dengan ketetapan, " kata Dinar.
Mengenai provinsi-provinsi yang belum menyampaikan laporannya, Dinar menduga bisa saja sudah diumumkan namun laporannya masih menyusul karena keputusannya belum ditandatangani oleh gubernur atau belum disampaikan kepada Kemnaker.***

Ministry of Manpower Waiting for Reports of All Provinces Regarding Minimum Wage Determination
03 Nov 2019, 14:17 by Satrio Widianto
JAKARTA, (PR) .- Director General of Industrial Relations Development and Labor Social Security (PHI and Jamsos) Ministry of Manpower, Haiyani Rumondang said, until now the Ministry of Manpower is still monitoring the establishment of Provincial Minimum Wage (UMP) by the governors.
"Today we continue to monitor and compile reports on the determination of the UMP from regions from all over Indonesia," Haiyani said in a press release at the Public Relations Bureau of the Ministry of Manpower, in Jakarta, Friday 3 November 2019.
According to Haiyani, the 2020 UMP increase is calculated based on a formula in accordance with Government Regulation (PP) No. 78 of 2015 concerning wages. The establishment of the UMP 2020 based on Article 9 of the Minister of Manpower Regulation Number 15 of 2018 concerning Minimum Wages is stipulated and announced simultaneously by the Governor of each region on November 1, 2019 with the governor's decision.
"So the point is to determine the 2020 UMP is the authority of the Governor. Based on data from Inflation and National Economic Growth from BPS, the 2020 Provincial Minimum Wage (UMP) increase of 8.51%," Haiyani said.
The Ministry of Manpower Wage Director, Dinar Titus Jogaswitani added that by Friday, November 1, 2019, 20 provinces had announced the stipulation and submitted reports on setting the provincial minimum wage (UMP) 2020 to the Ministry of Manpower.
Of the 20 provinces that have submitted reports on the amount of the UMP, as many as 19 are in accordance with Government Regulation Number 78 of 2015 concerning Wages. "However, 1 province among them is still not in accordance with the provisions," said Dinar.
Regarding the provinces that have not submitted their reports, Dinar suspects that it could have been announced but the report still follows because the decision has not been signed by the governor or has not been submitted to the Ministry of Manpower. ***
